topic.title: Provision Panasonic Phones with
topic.shortdesc: This guide provides instructions on how to provision Panasonic phones with . The details in this guide takes Panasonic HDV130 running firmware 01.008 as an example.

section.title: Factory reset the phone
section.p: Before provisioning the phone, you must reset the phone to factory defaults in case the device has residual settings of a previous configuration. To reset the phone, see .

ol.li:
Connect the phone to the same network of the .
Make sure that the phone and PBX are located in the same network segment, and do not connect the network via VPN.
Check the phones' MAC address and phone model, usually you can find them at the back of phone.

Log in web interface, go to Auto Provisioning page, click Scan to scan phones in the local network.
All the detected phones appear on the page.
Find the phone from Device List, and then click .
Assign an extension for the phone.

Click Save.
A pop-up dialog prompts you whether to reboot the phone immediately.

Click Yes.
The IP phone reboots automatically to get and apply configurations from the PBX.

li.p: If the IP phone doesn't reboot automatically, you need to reboot the phone manually to take effect.
Each time the IP phone reboots, it always gets the configurations from the PBX. In this case, the personal settings on the phone may be lost after the phone reboots.

section.title: Extended phone configuration
section.p: In addition to provision phone lines, you can provision other phone settings to match your needs.
section.note: Extended phone configurations vary on each phone model.

li.p: Enable or disable the phone features, such as Call Waiting, Voicemail, Key As Send, etc.
Configure the phone preference settings, such as Web Language, Time Zone, Admin Password, etc.
Select and configure the preferred codec list for the phone.

p.note: At least one of the same codecs on the phone and the PBX is required, or there will be no audio in the call.
